channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Half fallen tree causes problems, 12th November
item.description:
The half fallen tree causes problems: it obscures the style and makes navigation for a novice difficult - way marker needed in the field to indicate the route of the PROW the headroom under the tree is very limited and makes use of the PROW risky the narrowness of the route and the action of cattle makes the surface unsuitable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witcombe Roman Villa, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large section of road missing., 12th November
item.description:
Entrance to side road has large section missing on corner of side road. this fills with watrer and is then invisible to motorists and cyclists. the missing section is over 100mm deep.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Farm pigs in several fields with public footpaths traversing., 12th November
item.description:
The pigs are NOT aggressive but doing what pigs do, rooting around in the soil which is becoming impassable. They are not contained or the paths are not separated making it very difficult to use PROW.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction of footway by detritus leaves and growth from verge, 12th November
item.description:
Between the pedestrianised section of Court Road and 53 Ermin Street, the whole section of this path is very narrow due to poor maintenance, caused by Tewkesbury Borough Council and put in low taxes before services. There is significant detritus, leaf, mould and overgrown bushes from the adjoining verge. I would appreciate action was taken to resolve this promptly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White Goods dumped at side of road, 12th November
item.description:
2 fridges(?) dumped at side of road near Motorway bridge Here is a precise what3words address, made of 3 random words. Every 3 metre square in the world has its own unique what3words address. ///restless.thousands.waltzed https://w3w.co/restless.thousands.waltzed ///users.blazing.helpful https://w3w.co/users.blazing.helpful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe damage to the tarmac has resulted in large hole., 12th November
item.description:
Outside 112 Charlton Lane, Cheltenham . The damage and uneven surface is dangerous to cyclists who have to swerve into the path of traffic to avoid it. This has been a problem for a while but has become more serious over the last few weeks due to heavy rainfall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 112, Charlton Lane, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard sustained damage, near problem pothole, 11th November
item.description:
The bollard on Ermin Way has been hit a number of times by drivers. This cannot now be seen at night as reflective markings are destroyed. It is next to the pothole reported on 5199366 and flooded area on 22033921, making it even more dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding causing road damage, 11th November
item.description:
What3Words location Ermin Way opposite BT phone exchange. Water continues to not drain. Previously raised on 22033719 which was closed with the farcical advice that it should clear in one hour after rain stops. This has been ongoing now for 7 days. It has now resulted in a large pothole which has formed and reported on 5199366.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
